metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25729 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description: Permission prompts for opening external schemes were only shown forContentPrincipals resulting in extensions being able to openthem without user interaction via ExpandedPrincipals. Thiscould lead to further malicious actions such as downloading files orinteracting with software already installed on the system. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR <102.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
